medical_history.chief_complaint: Infertility associated with idiopathic hypogonadotropic hypogonadism (IHH).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at age 18 with incomplete puberty characterized by decreased virilization, high-pitched voice, and eunuchoidal body proportions. The patient reported a normal libido and erections but was unable to ejaculate or complete intercourse. He was lost to follow-up for 8 years before seeking treatment at age 26.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Mild form of idiopathic hypogonadotropic hypogonadism; previously prescribed testosterone replacement at age 18 but therapy was not instituted due to financial difficulties.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of normal virilization; the mother had normal puberty and menstrual cycles. No family history of delayed puberty or infertility.
medical_history.social_history: Denies use of anabolic steroids or nutritional supplements. Normal diet with no history of excessive exercise.
